replies.bodyText:
getSeconds only gets the seconds from the duration, i.e., not the total number of whole seconds in the duration
toSeconds is added since 9,, so we can't use it unfortunately. :(
https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/11/docs/api/java.base/java/time/Duration.html#toSeconds()
replies.author: zoewangg

replies.bodyText: http://hg.openjdk.java.net/jdk9/jdk9/jdk/file/7f644a5d554a/src/java.base/share/classes/java/time/Duration.java they seem to have the same impl :P

replies.bodyText: Interesting! Didn't know they have the same impl. Why do they have two APIs then?! 🤔

replies.bodyText:
Found this relevant link: https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8142936
TL;DR They added toSeconds to be consistent with other toXXX methods

timeline.bodyText: nit: Duration doesn't have a single unit so I don't think it would make sense to say "in seconds" here. We might want to add a note on the setter that it only supports seconds precision though
